Legal_Issue: Whether the PRRA Officer erred in not holding an oral hearing and in denying the PRRA application
Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (IRPA) s.113(b)
Application_Facts: PRRA Officer evaluated all evidence, found no new material facts differing from RPD findings
Decision_Outcome: PRRA application rejected due to insufficient new evidence
Defendant_Behavior: PRRA Officer followed proper procedure and applied reasonableness standard
Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged procedural unfairness and error in refusing oral hearing
Assessment_Factor: Presence of new material evidence, credibility issues, exceptional circumstances
Procedural_Issue: Requirement for oral hearing under IRPA s.113(b)
Evidence_Used: Evidence submitted in PRRA application, prior RPD findings
Application_Basis: Lack of new material facts warranting different outcome
Evidence_Assessed: All evidence reviewed; no significant changes from RPD stage
Relief_Sought: Overturn PRRA decision, obtain protection from removal
Governing_Rule: Oral hearing required only in exceptional circumstances
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Insufficient new evidence to support claim
Outcome: PRRA application denied, judicial review dismissed
Cause_Description: Applicant's PRRA application was rejected due to insufficient new evidence to overturn prior RPD findings
Evidence_Handling: PRRA Officer assessed all submitted evidence without requiring oral hearing
Evidence_Issues: No new or compelling evidence presented
Evidence_Assessment: Comprehensive assessment conducted; no exceptional circumstances found
Decision_Rationale: Decision was reasonable and consistent with IRPA standards
